text: Louis Wade Sullivan (born November 3, 1933) is an American health policy leader, minority health advocate, author, physician, and educator. He served as the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services during President George H. W. Bushâ€˜s Administration from 1989 through 1993 and was Founding Dean of the Morehouse School of Medicine. ==Other websites== * Official Website for Louis W. Sullivan, M.D. * Official Website for The Sullivan Alliance * Excerpt from Missing Persons: Minorities in the Health Professions * Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:United States Secretaries of Health and Human Services Category:American activists Category:American physicians Category:Educators from Atlanta Category:African- American writers Category:African-American politicians Category:Writers from Atlanta Category:Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Louis Wade Sullivan
